channel.title: I need some help from an experienced coder
channel.description:
Woodcutting has been one of the only problems I am facing with creating my server if anyone can have a look at it and try to fix it that would be great.
Problem:
When the tree falls it will never come back untill I restart server.
That problem came with the source im using (HiyascapeV2)
Thankyou

item.title: I need some help from an experienced coder
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:7, topic:182493”]It’s quite clear.

I say do this, this is off the top of my head:

Once this ‘tree’ has been cut down, a stump will appear(MakeGlobalObject) the timer is set, lets say at 200. After the timer has reached 0, the ‘stump’, will revert back into a tree(DeleteObject, MakeGlobalObject).[/quote]
Precisely. Good explanation.

Read full topic
item.source: I need some help from an experienced coder

item.title: I need some help from an experienced coder
item.dc:creator: @The-Legend The-Legend
item.description:
@The-Legend wrote:

im a noob lol speak to me in noob language. I am fine making everything on my server just can’t get trees to respawn.
Sorry about my lack of coding abilities.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 17, 2008, 11:39:39 PM[/size][hr]Want me to post the code I have?

Read full topic
item.source: I need some help from an experienced coder

item.title: I need some help from an experienced coder
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

It’s quite clear.

I say do this, this is off the top of my head:

Once this ‘tree’ has been cut down, a stump will appear(MakeGlobalObject) the timer is set, lets say at 200. After the timer has reached 0, the ‘stump’, will revert back into a tree(DeleteObject, MakeGlobalObject).

Read full topic
item.source: I need some help from an experienced coder
